Congratulations to Debbie Johnson, our 700th online participant on The City!

Groups on The City extend the community at Heritage Baptist

93 % of you have already joined a group in The City. If you are one of the 7%, click here to visit the City, click “Groups,” and find a group for your Adult Bible Fellowship, ministry team, or join the Needs and Ministry Opportunities group to learn of opportunities help other people.

City 101

If you are struggling with understanding how the City works, click here to visit our City 101 training page to watch helpful tutorials and learn how to update your information and connect with others.

City 201

If you are a group leader needing help understanding how to manage your group and use it effectively, click here to see City 201 training.

Helpful Tip

Did you know that you can respond to City posts right from your email without needing to go to The City website? It only works if you choose “New Things” or “Everything” for your email setting in a group. Replies from your email will be posted to the City and sent out to others in the group based on their email settings. If you have the “Daily Digest” email setting for some groups, consider switching to “New Things” so you can respond directly from your email!

global_topic.body:
Just got this from Lori today:

“We had a client call on our emergency line on Saturday determined to abort her baby. She was pretty upset on the phone. We were able to take the mobile out to her home in Madison Heights on Saturday evening after she got off work where she ending up making a decision to keep her baby! All glory to God!”

This is why we partner with BRPC! If you want to get involved, shoot me an email at adam@hbclynchburg.com and I’ll point you in the right direction.

posts.body: That is wonderful news! God is AwEsOmE!! Praise His name on high…
What wonderful news about a great ministry!
This is why HBC partners with BRPC!!!! Such celebration and the BRPC is full of stories like this. We are fortunate to have a mobile unit available in our area and willing people to staff it.
It is always a blessing to see someone get past the confusion, fear, and distrust and make the right decision – especially when it involves a life!  God is good!
Thank God for both baby and Mom. This is quite a miracle. Such a right decision.

I love it!  God is so good and I’m thankful for BRPC and others like it, especially the mobile unit.  I pray this news will spread and encourage others to invest in mobile units to save lives and bring more glory to our great and awesome God!
that one life (two lives, actually) has paid for the truck completely!
